definition[0]: to leave a group of people or an organization, especially because you have had a disagreement with them
example[0]: She had broken with her family years ago.
example[1]: They broke with the Communist Party and set up a new party.
definition[1]: to stop following old customs and do something in a completely different way
example[2]: Now is the time to break with the past.
example[3]: His work broke with tradition in many ways.
